a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Death rate from unsafe water sources vs. share of population living in
Extreme poverty is defined as living below the International Poverty Line of $2.15 per day. This data is adjusted for inflation
and for differences in the cost of living between countries.
Deaths from unsafe water sources per 100,000 people (deaths per 100,000 people)
Data source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2024); World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2024)
Note: Poverty data is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured
after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, per capita.
